meanings.definition: To free from something objectionable or undesirable.
meanings.sent1: She riddered her room of dust and clutter.
meanings.sent2: He always riddered the garden of weeds on Saturdays.
meanings.sent3: The magical broom riddered the house of all dirt with a wave.
meanings.sent4: Her smile riddered his heart of all worries.
meanings.sent5: The superhero riddered the city of crime and injustice.

meanings.definition: A person who rids or clears something.
meanings.sent1: The ridder arrived to clean the stables.
meanings.sent2: The ridder was known for keeping the streets clean.
meanings.sent3: The young ridder cleared the path of fallen leaves with a whistle.
meanings.sent4: She was a ridder of clutter, always organizing everything.
meanings.sent5: The ridder of the forest ensured all trails were clear for hikers.

meanings.definition: To relieve or deliver from something.
meanings.sent1: The medicine riddered him of his headache quickly.
meanings.sent2: She riddered her friend of worry by listening attentively.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gift riddered her of any doubts about his feelings.
meanings.sent4: His words riddered her of any fears she had about the future.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture riddered the community of any tensions.
